P005646.project_name: Banque de Developpement Economique de la Tunisie Project (08)

keywords.cdata: ADB,administrative procedures,balance of payments,Balance Sheets,basic metals,capital formation,capital goods,comparative advantage,competitive prices,competitiveness,current prices,decentralization,development strategy,domestic market,domestic markets,durable goods,Economic Rate of Return,Economic Trends,economies of scale,EIB,elasticity,employment,Equity Investments,exports,feasibility studies,Financial Performance,FINANCIAL SECTOR,finished products,foreign exchange,furnaces,GDP,gross fixed capital formation,growth rate,import quotas,imports,Income,Income Statements,interest rate,Intermediate Goods,international standards,labor force,Labor Productivity,large public enterprises,LDCs,local enterprises,local production,market difficulties,mines,operating costs,price control,price controls,private sector,Productivity,quality standards,resource allocation,substitution,suppliers,Technical Assistance,transport,value added,wages

project_abstract.cdata: The proposed loan would consist of: (i) a $28 million credit line of which one half (Part A) would be for financing priority electrical and mechanical industries, the other half (Part B) for general purpose lending to industry; (ii) a $2 million technical assistance subloan from BDET to the Government (Part C) to support the establishment of a Technical Center for Mechanical Industries and a National Institute of Standardization and Quality Control, and the preparation of an Effective Protection Study; and (iii) $0.5 million to finance the front-end fee. Also, in the context of the project: BDET would be required to allocate $30 million of its overall lending to EMI in 1982-1984, of which two-thirds to priority EMI subsectors; a set of incentives specific to EMI affecting tariff protection, price controls, exports and financing would be implemented; and two studies on development strategies for the platework and foundry subsectors would be prepared.
